query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
1 Quando per dilettanze o ver per doglie, 2 che alcuna virtù nostra comprenda, 3 l’anima bene ad essa si raccoglie,
query.error: **English:** 1 When, through delight or else through sorrow, 2 some power of ours apprehends, 3 the soul gathers itself wholly to that,
query.result: 1 Þonne ðurh willan oððe ðurh wænan, 2 ðæt ænig mægen uncre oncnæweð, 3 ðonne gæð se mod ðærto eallunga,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
4 par ch’a nulla potenza più intenda; 5 e questo è contra quello error che crede 6 ch’un’anima sovr’ altra in noi s’accenda.
query.error: **English:** 4 it seems that it attends to no other power; 5 and this is against that error which believes 6 that one soul is kindled within us above another.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
7 E però, quando s’ode cosa o vede 8 che tegna forte a sé l’anima volta, 9 vassene ’l tempo e l’uom non se n’avvede;
query.error: **English:** 7 And therefore, when one hears or sees something 8 that strongly attracts the soul, 9 time passes and one does not notice it;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
10 ch’altra potenza è quella che l’ascolta, 11 e altra è quella c’ha l’anima intera: 12 questa è quasi legata e quella è sciolta.
query.error: **English:** 10 for there is another power that listens to it, 11 and there is another that possesses the soul entirely: 12 the one is almost bound and the other is free.
query.result: 10 forðæm ðær is oðer miht ðe ðæt gehýrð, 11 and oðer is ðe ðone mód alne hæfð: 12 ðeos is swilce gebunden and ðeos is unbunden.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
13 Di ciò ebb’ io esperïenza vera, 14 udendo quello spirto e ammirando; 15 ché ben cinquanta gradi salito era
query.error: **English:** 13 Of this I had true experience, 14 hearing that spirit and wondering; 15 for the sun had already climbed fifty degrees,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
16 lo sole, e io non m’era accorto, quando 17 venimmo ove quell’ anime ad una 18 gridaro a noi: «Qui è vostro dimando».
query.error: **English:** 16 and I had not noticed, when 17 we came to where those souls together 18 cried out to us: "Here is your request."
query.result: 16 fiftig ðinga, and ic ðæs ne gymde, 17 oððæt we comon ðær ða sawla samod 18 clypedon to us: "Her is eower wilnung."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
19 Maggiore aperta molte volte impruna 20 con una forcatella di sue spine 21 l’uom de la villa quando l’uva imbruna,
query.error: **English:** 19 Many times a greater opening imprisons 20 with a little fork of its thorns 21 the man of the village when the grape darkens,
query.result: 19 Mærða openra oft gelome 20 mid anre furcu his þyrnena 21 þone wer of þorpum ðonne wînberga

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
22 che non era la calla onde salìne 23 lo duca mio, e io appresso, soli, 24 come da noi la schiera si partìne.
query.error: **English:** 22 than was the path by which my leader climbed, 23 and I behind him, alone, 24 when the troop departed from us.
query.result: 22 blæc berað, þonne his blæd is onhæled, 23 ne wæs ðæt sellic ðe min latteow fand, 24 and ic æfter folgode, þa we twegen wæron,

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
25 Vassi in Sanleo e discendesi in Noli, 26 montasi su in Bismantova e ’n Cacume 27 con esso i piè; ma qui convien ch’om voli;
query.error: **English:** 25 He goes down to Sanleo and descends to Noli, 26 climbs up Bismantova and Cacume 27 with his feet; but here it is necessary that one fly;

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
28 dico con l’ale snelle e con le piume 29 del gran disio, di retro a quel condotto 30 che speranza mi dava e facea lume.
query.error: **English:** 28 I say with swift wings and with the feathers 29 of great desire, following that guide 30 who gave me hope and made light for me.
query.result: 28 Ic secge mid ðām hrædum ðingum and mid ðām feðrum 29 ðæs miclan gewilnunga, æfter ðām lærendum 30 ðe me hyht sealde and leoht geworhte.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
31 Noi salavam per entro ’l sasso rotto, 32 e d’ogne lato ne stringea lo stremo, 33 e piedi e man volea il suol di sotto.
query.error: **English:** 31 We climbed through the broken rock, 32 and on each side the narrow pass hemmed us in, 33 and the ground below demanded hands and feet.
query.result: 31 We stigon ðurh ðone rofenne stan, 32 and us on æghwylce healfe stiðra clifu, 33 and ða fæste næssas neðan eaðmæte.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
34 Poi che noi fummo in su l’orlo suppremo 35 de l’alta ripa, a la scoperta piaggia, 36 «Maestro mio», diss’ io, «che via faremo?».
query.error: **English:** 34 After we were on the topmost edge 35 of the high bank, on the open plain, 36 "My master," I said, "what path shall we take?"
query.result: 34 Þa we wæron on ðam ufeweardan brince 35 ðæs hean hliðes, on ða openan sæ, 36 "Min lareow," cwæð ic, "hwæt wille we nu don?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
37 Ed elli a me: «Nessun tuo passo caggia; 38 pur su al monte dietro a me acquista, 39 fin che n’appaia alcuna scorta saggia».
query.error: **English:** 37 And he to me: "Let not your step falter; 38 just keep climbing the mountain behind me, 39 until some wise guide appears to you."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
40 Lo sommo er’ alto che vincea la vista, 41 e la costa superba più assai 42 che da mezzo quadrante a centro lista.
query.error: **English:** 40 The summit is so high that it conquers the sight, 41 and the proud slope is much steeper 42 than the arc of a quadrant from its center to its edge.
query.result: 40 Se ðæs beorgæs hlið ðæs heán wære 41 ðæt ðæs gesihðes ðæs monnes mihte 42 ofer ðone munt stigan ðurh ðone steápne weg.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
43 Io era lasso, quando cominciai: 44 «O dolce padre, volgiti, e rimira 45 com’ io rimango sol, se non restai».
query.error: **English:** 43 I was weary, when I began: 44 "O sweet father, turn and look, 45 how I remain alone, if you do not stay."
query.result: 43 Ic wæs wærig, ða ic ðæt word gecwæð: 44 "Eala ðu leofa fæder, gewit ðu, and geseoh 45 hu ic ana wudu wunige ana wædle, gif ðu me ne hilpst."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
46 «Figliuol mio», disse, «infin quivi ti tira», 47 additandomi un balzo poco in sùe 48 che da quel lato il poggio tutto gira.
query.error: **English:** 46 "My son," he said, "come this far with me," 47 pointing out to me a ledge a little higher up 48 that goes all around the hill on that side.
query.result: 46 "Min sunu," cwæð he, "hi ðær ðu ðe tihhest," 47 æteowde me ða beorg lyt ðanon up, 48 ðe on ða healfe ðone beorg ymbclyppeð.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
49 Sì mi spronaron le parole sue, 50 ch’i’ mi sforzai carpando appresso lui, 51 tanto che ’l cinghio sotto i piè mi fue.
query.error: **English:** 49 His words so spurred me on, 50 that I strained myself, following close behind him, 51 until the belt was under my feet.
query.result: 49 Swa me his worda gewehton ða, 50 ðæt ic me folgode ðurh ðone feorran weg, 51 oð ðæt ðæt geweorc under minra feta wæs.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
52 A seder ci ponemmo ivi ambedui 53 vòlti a levante ond’ eravam saliti, 54 che suole a riguardar giovare altrui.
query.error: **English:** 52 There we sat down together 53 facing east, from where we had climbed, 54 which is usually helpful for looking at things.
query.result: 52 Þær we sæton samod ætgædere 53 wendon us eastweard ðanon we ær comon, 54 ðæt is gewunelic ðæt mon sceawige eft.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
55 Li occhi prima drizzai ai bassi liti; 56 poscia li alzai al sole, e ammirava 57 che da sinistra n’eravam feriti.
query.error: **English:** 55 First I turned my eyes to the low shores; 56 then I raised them to the sun, and marveled 57 that we were smitten by it from the left.
query.result: 55 Þa ic ærst mine eagan uppalóh 56 and geseah ða sunnan on ðære swiðran healfe, 57 and ða sæ on ðære winstran healfe.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.

query.result: 58 ða wearð se scop gewær ðæt ic stód 59 eal forhwyrfed æt ðære leohte wæne, 60 ðær heo betwux us and norðan wind com.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
100 Al suon di lei ciascun di noi si torse, 101 e vedemmo a mancina un gran petrone, 102 del qual né io né ei prima s’accorse.
query.error: **English:** 100 At the sound of her, each of us turned, 101 and we saw on the left a great rock, 102 which neither I nor he had noticed before.
query.result: 100 Æt ðæs hleopre stefne we us gehwylce wendon, 101 and we gesawon ða on ðære wynstran healfe micelne stan, 102 ðone ne ic ne he ær ne gesawon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
103 Là ci traemmo; e ivi eran persone 104 che si stavano a l’ombra dietro al sasso 105 come l’uom per negghienza a star si pone.
query.error: **English:** 103 There we came; and there were people 104 who were standing in the shade behind a rock, 105 as a man places himself to stand out of idleness.
query.result: 103 Þær we eodon; and þær wæron men 104 þe stodon on sceadewe beæftan stane 105 swa man for neawnesse hine settan wille.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
106 E un di lor, che mi sembiava lasso, 107 sedeva e abbracciava le ginocchia, 108 tenendo ’l viso giù tra esse basso.
query.error: **English:** 106 And one of them, who seemed weary to me, 107 was sitting and embracing his knees, 108 holding his face down low between them.
query.result: 106 And an ðara, ðe me ðuhte ðearle gefeónde, 107 sæt and cneowas fæðmode, 108 heold ðone wlitegan wlite on ðære eorðan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
109 «O dolce segnor mio», diss’ io, «adocchia 110 colui che mostra sé più negligente 111 che se pigrizia fosse sua serocchia».
query.error: **English:** 109 "O my sweet lord," I said, "look at 110 the one who shows himself more negligent 111 than if Sloth were his sister."
query.result: 109 "Eala ðu min leofa hlaford," cwæð ic, "geseoh 110 ðone ðe ðone slæwcraftost on him sylfum æteowð, 111 swilce his sweostor wære ðæs slæpes degn."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Old English.
112 Allor si volse a noi e puose mente, 113 movendo ’l viso pur su per la coscia, 114 e disse: «Or va tu sù, che se’ valente!».

query.result: 112 Þa he wende hine to us and geaf ðam mode, 113 afyrsiende ðone wlite ofer ða wombe, 114 and cwæð: "Nu ðu gæst up, forðæm ðu eart wyrðe!"

118 ch’a lui fu’ giunto, alzò la testa a pena, 119 dicendo: «Hai ben veduto come ’l sole 120 da l’omero sinistro il carro mena?».

124 di te omai; ma dimmi: perché assiso 125 quiritto se’? attendi tu iscorta, 126 o pur lo modo usato t’ha’ ripriso?».
